your antivirus may/will detect paul.dll and skidrow.dll as a potential or actual virus.
they are NOT
and you will need to add an exception to your a/v 

ESET users HOW TO: (version 5)
older versions are very similar
-------------------------------

RECOVERING DELETED FILES BY ESET
--------------------------------
1] double click your icon in the tray by the clock and hit F5
2] in the left pane click tools> then in the right pane click quarantine
3] the two files at the top (skidrow.dll and paul.dll) can be right clicked>retored. Some people have luck with right click>restore AND exclude from detection. if it is greyed out read on.

EXCLUDING FROM DETECTION
------------------------
1] double click your icon in the tray by the clock and hit F5
2] go to computer>antivirus and antispyware>exclusions
3] in the right pane click add
4] navigate to you folder that has been extracted (-=UPDATE=- - wherever you extracted to and choose the paull.dll file click ok
5] repeat steps 3 & 4 again for skidrow.dll.
6] when you copy these 2 files to your installation directory you may or may not need to do steps 3-5 again but this time pointing to where you copied the cracked files (your installation dir)
